content: Do we have these inequalities for Matrix.dotProduct elsewhere?
I'll take "no reply" as "not to my knowledge" and kick off the review process.
I tried to create a different PR #9693 depending on this PR, but I probably failed to indicate it on GitHub properly.
@maintainers Can you please check the PR dependencies to be valid?
I don't think there's any sense of "valid" beyond adding PR numbers to the description
If you put them in the wrong place, then the bot won't apply the label (or will remove it if you try to apply it yourself)
I just learnt the second part, yes.
Unfortunately, the list of commits doesn't seem to acknowledge that PR #9693 is not a branch of master.
I tried to create lpm as a branch of dp-ineq.
To git there is no such concept as "is a branch of"
A branch is just a name for a commit that can be moved in a natural way to child commits (but the movement itself is not tracked on the server)
This is also why we have the "depends on" thing manually. Just wait for the dependent PR to land, then merge master, and your diff in the new PR will make sense again
You mean wait for the PR to be merged, and only then the diff of the new PR will be OK?
You might have to ensure that the new PR is based off of the merge commit of the old PR. (i.e. do a git merge master or git rebase master on the new PR branch when the old PR is merged.)
Martin Dvořák has marked this topic as resolved.
